name: Gili Danda
description: Gilli Danda is a traditional sport played in India, similar to cricket and baseball. It involves a small wooden stick (gilli) and a larger stick (danda). The objective is to hit the gilli with the danda and score points by running between two designated areas.

name: Pitthu
description: Pitthu, also known as Lagori, is a popular outdoor game in India. It involves stacking flat stones (pitthu) and trying to knock them down with a ball. The team that successfully knocks down the stack and rebuilds it while avoiding being hit by the opposing team's ball wins the game.

name: Kabaddi
description: Kabaddi is a contact team sport that originated in India. It involves two teams, where one team sends a 'raider' into the opposing team's half to tag as many defenders as possible and return to their own half without being tackled. The game requires agility, strength, and strategy.

name: Langdi
description: Langdi is a traditional Indian game that involves hopping on one leg while trying to tag opponents. The game is played in a designated area, and players must maintain their balance while attempting to catch others. It is a fun and energetic game that promotes agility and coordination.

name: Chain
description: Chain is a popular outdoor game in India that involves forming a human chain to catch opponents. Players hold hands to create a chain, and the objective is to tag or catch members of the opposing team while avoiding being caught themselves. The game requires teamwork, strategy, and quick reflexes.
